item.content:encoded:
School of Business

Digital Animation

The BM College Digital Animation program prepares students to work in the gaming, film, and television industries. The program is broken down into series of collaborative courses that focus on skills that blend traditional art with high-end technology through several industry standard applications and techniques. Trained and supervised by industry professional instructors, students acquire both creative, design, and technical skills that prepare them for the demanding fields in these industries. Our successful graduates have been working in a variety of 3D modeling and animation positions at game production studios, video production companies, and design studios nationwide and around the world. The work of some of our graduates could be found in productions of game and films studios such as: Electronic Arts, Radical, Microsoft game studios, Bioware, Nerd-Corps, The Embassy, A.C.R.O.N.Y.M. Games, Capcom, Rainmaker, Eidos, and Pixar.

BM College Digital Animation students learn to:

  • Design and create concept art for 3D models
  • Develop a storyboard for animation
  • Conceptualize characters and props
  • Stage a virtual environments and scene
  • Use industry standard 3D applications to transform the concept art into 3D assets
  • Create 2D and 3D animations
  • Design and produce textures for character and props
  • Sculpt and create high detail models
  • Create realistic textures and lighting
  • Design and optimize 3D assets for game production
  • Create and setup a game level in industry standard engines
  • Create film quality CG objects
  • Render and composite an industry standard professional demo reel
BM College DIGITAL ANIMATION CERTIFICATE
BM College Credential: BM College Certificate
Program Length: 1 year, Full-time
Program Start: October & April
Location: London Campus
Number of Courses: 20 courses, 69 credits
Total Tuition/Cost: Learn about Tuition & Fees
Major Project: 3D modeling/Animation Demo Reel

Animation Demo Reel

As a final project, students complete a high quality 3D modeling and/or animation demo reel that can lead to jobs in the gaming, film and animation industries locally and abroad. In addition to creating a demo reel, students learn how to prepare for the job market by writing resumes, working on interview skills, networking techniques, public speaking, and presentation skills towards landing a job in the entertainment industry.

Digital Animation Jobs & Careers

Graduates of the BM College Digital Animation certificate program develop a strong appreciation for game, film and animation production pipeline that includes: Concept design, project planning, 3D modeling, texturing, rigging, animating, lighting, rendering, and compositing. During the intense year, students gain valuable skills that lead them to a wide variety of digital animation job opportunities.

Entry-Level Positions:

  • 3D Animator
  • Character Modeler
  • VFX Artist
  • CG Artist

Mid-Level Positions:

  • Creative Director
  • Technical Director
  • Senior Animator
  • Team Lead

item.content:encoded:
SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES
Technical Web Designer

Advance your web design skill set and qualify to industry standards

The TWD program is a hands-on program combining current web design technologies with challenging assignments, structured projects, and industry experience.

By using a “best practices” approach to web design, you will create sites that are not only visually appealing but are also accessible, usable, and standards compliant. You will use the latest web design software to develop a number of large sites. Upon completion of the TWD program, you will have a web portfolio showcasing your work.

By the end of the program, you will be able to:

Hand code web pages using HTML / HTML5 and CSS / CSS3
Learn to code responsive and mobile websites
Design graphics for the Web using Photoshop and Illustrator
Utilize PHP, JavaScript and jQuery
Work with Content Management Systems â€“ WordPress
Develop online stores using WordPress and WooCommerce
Lead effective projects and work in teams
Manage and promote web sites – SEO, Web Analytics
Prepare proposals and deliver presentations to clients
You will learn techniques in application development, be exposed to several current web technologies, and apply system development best practices to design and develop usable, effective web applications and web sites.
The program is delivered through classroom instruction, hands-on lab work and individual and team projects. Applicants for the Technical Web Designer program should also possess sound logical and reasoning abilities, as well as good communication skills – both written and oral. Applicants should also have a working knowledge of Windows, Microsoft Office, and desktop applications such as Photoshop and Dreamweaver.

Looking for free help to redesign your website? Contact the HTP department htp@BM College.ca for student projects.

BM CollegeÂ Graphic Communications Technology

Full-time Â Â Â  Diploma

The world of printed communications is expanding and evolving at a rapid pace. Traditional print products are supplemented by digital delivery and technology advances in high-tech digital imaging. Graphic communications companies need highly skilled individuals andÂ BM College graduates are driving print media into the future.

The BM College Graphic Communications Technology (GTEC) diploma program provides students with the knowledge and skills to succeed in the business of digital imaging. In this program, you will design and produce marketing materials such as posters, large format signage, labels, brochures, books, and other finished products that organizations need to communicate with a connected and informed audience. You learn the latest graphic design software, business processes, art direction, production management, and how to operate high-tech imaging and finishing technologies.

As aÂ BM College Graphic Communications student, you learn these career-ready skills:

  • Devise business and marketing strategies incorporating print media
  • Use the latest graphic design software for effective visual communication
  • Design and create a variety of printed media projects
  • Use fonts and typography professionally
  • Operate many different high-tech imaging technologies
  • Use modern finishing techniques to complete real-world projects

Print & Imaging Job Placements

You will participate in a two week work experience at the end of the first year of study and a six week job placement in your graduating year. You will work with an established company to demonstrate your job ready skills and develop connections in the design, print imaging and publishing industries.

A Career in Printed Media

Graduates of the BM College Graphic Communications program have extensive experience in operating, the latest in high-tech imaging systems. Graduates get hands on experience with digital, ink-jet, lithographic and flexographic processes in our modern lab. Design, print, large format, digital, label, and packaging companies are all hiring from the Graphic Communications Technology program.
